args: I have finished tending the fields, Cleo.
It was enough for you to stay here in the\ncastle with meâ€”I didn't expect you to\nhelp with chores as well.
And yet, watching the castle and caring\nfor the fields are both important tasks.
The last thing we want is for our\nstronghold to be overrun by the enemy.
Incidentally, I heard that you are quite\nfamiliar with the history of this country.
I suppose you could say that, yes.
I hope to learn more about the history of\nAlberia, and specifically how humans\nand dragons came to live side-by-side.
I'd be happy to tell you what I know.
While they may live in harmony now,\nhumans and dragons were once the\ngreatest of enemies.
History tells us the battle between them\nwas a fearsome one indeed.

But one day, a great calamity appeared
in this world, and the races joined forces
in order to beat it back and restore peace
across the land.
That is how the current relationship\ncame about.
Might I ask where your interest\nin this matter comes from?
I have just been thinking about somethiâ€”
We were saving a child who had been\ncaptured by fiends...
N-no, it's okay. I'm fiiii... Aaargh!
Another act of recklessness, I assume.\nYou can tell me all about it after\nI heal you.
Allow me to assist you, Cleo!

I honestly feel ready to get back to work,
but Cleo said that if I didn't take at least
three days off, she'd poison my lunch.
I don't THINK she's serious, but...
Heh. Her healing magic truly is amazing.
Oh, it isâ€”and I've taken advantage\nof it more times than I can count.\nI feel terrible for all the worry I cause.
It is a difficult thing indeed to help\nboth yourself and others.
But the thought of letting even a single\nperson die is often too much to bear.
I completely understand what you mean.\nI don't want anyone to be hurt if there's\nany way to avoid it.
And yet, I think you are forgetting an\nimportant piece of the puzzle.
No matter how gallant the action,\nits meaning is lost if you do not\nlive on afterward.
You must survive in order to enact the\nwill of your friendsâ€”and your kingdom.
This is the duty of one charged\nwith saving an entire country.

That is not an original thought, I fear.
It is something I was told by a friend
when I first learned my sister had
entrusted me with my country's future.
That was the moment I realized my life\ndoes not belong to me alone.
That definitely sounds like something\nI should think about.
I need to become even stronger than I am\nso I can protect both the people I care\nabout and my own skin.
Looking at you feels like looking\nat my past self.
At first, I wasn't certain we were truly as\nsimilar as your friends were suggesting,\nbut now I see it is indeed the case.
It's hard to believe we come from\nsuch different worlds.
It feels like we've known each other\nfor our entire lives.
Agreed. But now that I am here,\nthere's something I wish to see\nwith my own two eyes.
I want to witness the kind of peace that\ncan be created through the bonds of\nhuman and dragon.
The war in my world may be over,\nbut dragons live on.
After coming here, I feel I have a duty to\nrealize the peace your world has found\nin my own.
I think that is the real reason I was\nbrought to this worldâ€”and why I\ncame to meet you.
To assist you on your own path to peace.
I know that to be true now.
In that case, I should be even more\ngrateful for our meeting.
Knowing you ended the conflict in your\nworld makes me even more determined\nto end the conflict in my own.
I'm going to show you that I can\nrealize the same peace here.
Your strength and altruism will see you\nto this end. I am certain of it.
Our time together may be short, but I want\nus to remain the best of friends during it.
Agreed! Let's make the most of what\nfate has given us!
